about.title: Welcome to Prosocial Tech Collab :)
about.body:
The goal of Prosocial Tech Collab (PTC) is to provide a dedicated space for people to find collaborators for projects related to prosocial tech, as well as to foster community and resource sharing.

We support builders of prosocial tech, as well as researchers, journalists, artists, and community organizers who are working on projects that advance the goals of prosocial technology.

more.title: What is Prosocial Technology?
more.body:
Prosocial technologies are digital tools, platforms, and systems that have been intentionally designed to promote positive social behaviors and enhance collective wellbeing.

How prosocial a technology is depends on both its design choices and the market incentives behind it — market incentives are what drive design practices that maximize engagement and profit, even when they come at the expense of user well-being.

For this reason, we focus on supporting projects that not only apply prosocial design principles, but adopt business practices that are sustainable and non-exploitative.

Not sure if your project is prosocial? This chart from Lisa Schirch and the Kroc Institute for International Peace Studies, the Council on Technology and Social Cohesion, and the Toda Peace Institute is a great reference:

findingCollaborators.title: FINDING COLLABORATORS
findingCollaborators.description: Find collaborators for your existing project, get connected to other people’s projects, or find like-minded people and come up with a project together

buildingCommunity.title: BUILDING COMMUNITY
buildingCommunity.description: Learn about PTC projects by participating in project demo sessions, brainstorm ideas with peers, get support from other practitioners, and meet like-minded people during small PTC gatherings.

fosteringResourceSharing.title: FOSTERING RESOURCE SHARING
fosteringResourceSharing.description: Share job postings and opportunities in prosocial tech, post about events related to prosocial tech, and share your favorite prosocial technology tools and concepts

engage.title: Multiple Ways to Engage
engage.body: In addition to serving as a space to find or share prosocial tech projects to collaborate on, our Slack group is where you’ll find info about upcoming project demos, social gatherings, support sessions, and small group discussions.

channels.title: PTC Project Channels
channels.body: Whether you’re looking to find collaborators for your current project, want to join someone else’s existing project, or are excited about creating something from scratch with like-minded people, PTC supports a range of different projects, including but not limited to:

appliedSocialMedia.title: APPLIED SOCIAL MEDIA
appliedSocialMedia.description: For prosocial apps, platforms, and websites in the alt-social media space, including community-building platforms and mental health interventions

artsAndCulture.title: ARTS & CULTURE
artsAndCulture.description: For art projects, exhibits, indie films, advocacy campaigns, and new cultural programs related to prosocial tech

civicTech.title: CIVIC TECH
civicTech.description: For projects that enhance the relationship between citizens and government, or projects that promote civic engagement and alternative governance structures

journalism.title: JOURNALISM & NARRATIVE
journalism.description: For journalism projects and narrative outputs related to prosocial tech, such as documentaries, grassroots publications, or contributing to newsletters

research.title: RESEARCH
research.description: For research projects related to prosocial tech, as well as other research-related outputs such as conferences and workshops

responsibleAI.title: RESPONSIBLE AI
responsibleAI.description: For responsible AI projects that promote prosocial design, such as improving upon recommender systems or developing open-source tools that support prosocial platforms

footer.title: We hope to see you there!
footer.contact: Have any questions? Reach out to team@prosocialtechcollab.com
